Description:
For gearheads, by gearheads — a federated network for those into gear: the heavy stuff, the light wear, the fetish made, the safety built, and everything in-between.

⚡️ Background

Due to increasing tensions relating to Twitter, niche groups who once called it home feel it is slowly crumbling away. As such, many people are jumping across to Mastodon — and this includes the relatively small, but substantial, assemblage of gearheads.

And so, Gearheads, starting out (and still existing) as a Telegram group of the same name, is now one of many many growing Mastodon providers. We aim to provide a safe space for those into the gear kink, as well as stable platform for your content.

Like every Mastodon provider, this one can talk across the federated network, allowing users from other providers to interact with it: if you already have a Mastodon account elsewhere, there's no need to even join this one! It's like your email: you only need one address to message anyone in the world.

Still confused about federation or Mastodon? See fedi.tips for more.

🆘 Need help?

If a post is bothering you, please use the Report @user feature under a post's overflow menu. We'll get on it as soon as we can.

Any other issues or concerns can be raised by tagging @staff, or tagging us directly:

  • Astra: @astra@gearheads.social
  • Ducky: @ducky@gearheads.social
  • Kalibur: @KaliburVuhuni@gearheads.social

As a last-ditch attempt, you can also shoot an email to hello@gearheads.social.

💸 Donations

Like literally every decent Mastodon instance, we are entirely ad-free and rely solely on the (sometimes shallow) pockets of its owners and tips for a lovely users. Considering chipping in if you can: our goal stands at just £12/mo.

Description:
glaceon.social is a community of people with diverse interests. This is a general instance with no specific topic you're required to stick to; feel free to talk about whatever! About the only constant is that if someone has an account here, they probably like pokemon at least a little. If that sounds like a good time, welcome to glaceon.social.

Please note that at this time, this is a primarily English-language instance. Unfortunately, I can only effectively moderate a site where the vast majority of posts are in the language I understand. I apologize for the inconvenience.

Guidelines

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and final interpretation is up to the administration of glaceon.social. They are here to provide you with insight into our philosophy and content moderation policies.

The following types of content may be removed from the public timeline at the discretion of the moderator.

  • Excessive advertising
  • Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
  • Untagged nudity, pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
  • Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  • Deliberately inflammatory content with the intent to trigger or hurt others, at the discretion of administration.

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service.

  • Racism or advocation of racism
  • Sexism or advocation of sexism
  • Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
  • Xenophobic and/or violent nationalism

The following types of content are explicitly disallowed and will result in revocation of access to the service.

  • Sexual depictions of children
  • Content illegal in Germany and/or France, such as holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
  • Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism (i.e. the Nazi party), the political far or "alt"-right, or Gamergate

Any conduct intended to stalk other users, or to impede other users from utilizing the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to harass other users, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, identified at the sole discretion of the administrator and moderators, is also disallowed, and subject to action up to and including revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviors:

  • Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist may be considered harassment, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
  • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox) may be considered harassment.
  • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement with that user to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling) may be considered harassment.

These provisions notwithstanding, the administration of the service reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

GDPR and CCPA

glaceon.social uses cookies to maintain your login session and for no other reason.

glaceon.social stores your email address, which is used as your account name to log you in. Your email is not visible to anyone but the administrators of the site. We do not send you email unless you request it.

glaceon.social has no advertising partners. Because of the nature of a federated social network, we share your non-private posts with other servers. However, we do not share your personal data, or aggregated non-personal data, with anyone. We do publish statistical data about the entire body of glaceon.social users as a way for others to measure the health of our instance, but your individual information cannot be extracted from those figures.

Scraping

Each user of glaceon.socail retains all copyright to the original content of posts they make on glaceon.social. You may not make a copy of any other user's posts for any purpose other than the normal functioning of ActivityPub federation and the RSS feeds generated by the Mastodon software of any content originally posted to glaceon.social without acquiring the affirmative consent of the administrator for each post you wish to copy. If you maintain such a copy of any post that originated on glaceon.social, you must regularly check back with the server to determine whether that post has been changed or removed, and you must update your copy or depiction to reflect any changes to the post, or remove your copy or depiction if the post has been removed.

Help, I've been suspended!

If you were a glaceon.social user and your account was suspended:

This is unlikely to be reverted. Account suspension is used as a measure of last resort. If you truly, truly believe that such a decision was made in error, contact admin@glaceon.social with a ban appeal. Please don't waste my time.

Note that the Mastodon software deletes all of a suspended user's data after 30 days. If 30 days have passed, your account cannot be unsuspended; the data no longer exists.

If you are a remote user and you believe your account or your instance was suspended by glaceon.social:

Again, this is unlikely to be reverted. Instance and remote account suspensions are intended to be final decisions. If you believe that an error has been made, contact admin@glaceon.social. Please don't waste my time.

Acknowledgements

All of our pokemon sprite emojis (other than a few obviously altered ones) were graciously provided by @Siphonay@donphan.social.

This code of conduct is based heavily on the one provided by Elekk, with permission. Thanks!

Description:
Hypnosis

HypnoGuys is a Mastodon server focused on guys who are into hypnosis, including (but not limited to) erotic applications. This is also commonly known as "erotic hypnosis" or "hypnokink". You do not have to be interested in hypnosis to join this server, but you must understand and accept that hypnosis is the theme of this server.

Gendered Space

HypnoGuys is a gendered space: as the name implies, this server is focused on guys. People of all genders and sexualities are allowed to use this server, as long as they understand that "guys" are the focus here. If you are looking for a Mastodon server focused on hypnosis without this focus on guys, Triggerphrase is an excellent option.

Note that sex and gender discrimination is not allowed on this server. Despite being a gendered space, HypnoGuys does not put down people who are not guys.

Content Warnings (CW)

Mastodon provides a "content warning" feature, where users can gate their posts behind a short piece of text, warning potential readers of what they are about to encounter. Content warnings (or CWs) must be used for content that involves explicit sex, such as fucking.

However, not all erotic content requires a CW on this server. Generally speaking, we follow the example set by the popular woof.group Mastodon server: anything that you might see in a leather bar is perfectly acceptable and does not require a content warning. Flirting, groping, jockstraps, boobs, butts, moderate impact, pup gear: no CW necessary. If you'd take it to the back bar or the playroom, use a CW. Genitals, piss, fucking, fisting, piercing, scat: CW please.

Check out the documentation for woof.group to see more about this policy.

Banned content

You may not post the following content on HypnoGuys:

  • Sexual content involving minors, including artistic depictions
  • Gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  • National Socialism
  • Nazism
  • Holocaust denial
  • Racism
  • Alt right, including under the disguise of freedom of speech
  • Gender-critical
  • Sex and gender discrimination
  • Transphobia
  • Misogyny
  • Pro-ana / Pro-mia

Banned activities

You may not engage in any of the following activities on HypnoGuys:

  • Automated sharing of third-party content, news sources, websites or social media content that doesn’t belong to you
  • Repeated trolling, insulting or derogatory comments towards others, even after they ask you to stop
  • Mass following and aggregation of content

Approved content

As long as you don't violate any of the above rules, you may post any content you want on HypnoGuys, whether related to hypnosis or not. In addition, here are some examples that are explicitly approved, and do belong on this server:

  • Discussions of hypnosis, including hypnotherapy and erotic hypnosis
  • Media related to hypnosis (such as spirals, art, photo manipulations, audio, video, etc) that you own, or that the owner has provided written permission for you to post
  • Advertising professional services related to hypnosis
  • Explicit sexual content, with an appropriate content warning

Description:
Opalstack

Mastodon for Professionals and Brands

Managed Hosting tailored for developers, entrepreneurs, and businesses. Benefit from our industry-leading support and focus on your market without the hassles of administration or content moderation.

Rules

We rigorously adhere to the Mastodon Server Covenant. The admin team actively addresses reports, offering guidance and, if necessary, immediate intervention in cases of abuse.

English Language Only

Effective from September 2023, accounts with non-English information in their profiles will be suspended. This measure addresses the surge of fake accounts promoting SPAM in other languages. Our admin team is proficient in English moderation, making it the exclusive language for our platform.

Server Blocking

We block instances promoting extreme political views (both far-right and far-left) due to their potential for abusive tactics and hate speech promotion. Additionally, instances with incompatible rules or technical issues that affect our server's functionality are subject to blocking. This includes, but is not limited to, kink, porn, anti-crypto, and anti-capitalist themed servers.

SPAM

Strictly prohibited. Accounts suspected of SPAM will be banned immediately. Maintaining the server's reputation is paramount. We emphasize personal interactions and robust moderation to prevent SPAM, which is detrimental to our and your reputation. Brand awareness works on Mastodon through one on one interactions and genuine content, not SPAM advertising.

Prohibition of Gambling and Betting Activities

We enforce a strict ban on all forms of gambling, gaming for money, betting, or related activities. This encompasses sharing links to gambling sites, discussing or promoting betting strategies, organizing betting pools, and any advertisements or sponsorships related to gambling. Violations may lead to warnings or bans, depending on the severity.

New Rule: Regulation of SPAM Content for Brands and Professionals

Link posting SPAM bots will not be tolerated. It doesn't work here. It harms the server. Build your own server or add ActivityPub to your website if you want this kind of engagement. This is an exploit pure and simple and we do not tolerate it.

Engagement and Authenticity

  1. Purposeful Engagement: Content must engage the Mastodon community or use the ActivityPub protocol. Purely promotional content without meaningful interaction is SPAM.

  2. Authenticity and Relevance: Posts should be authentic, relevant, and add value. Repetitive, irrelevant, or solely promotional content is considered SPAM.

  3. Community Standards: Brands and professionals should foster community by participating in discussions, responding to feedback, and sharing content that reflects the interests and values of the Mastodon community.

  4. Closed Enrollment Policy: To maintain quality and community engagement, open enrollment is closed. New members are selectively admitted based on alignment with community values and standards.

Non-compliance may lead to content removal, warnings, or account suspension. These rules aim to balance professional and brand contributions with the ethos of Mastodon and ActivityPub.
Short: For professionals and brands. Focus on your market, not administration.

Description:
PL:

Mastodon Poland to wskrzeszenie dawnej instancji, którą po raz pierwszy, testowo uruchomiliśmy w lipcu 2019 roku. Chcemy zapewnić bezpieczną i bezpłatną instancję otwartej sieci społecznościowej Mastodon, chroniąc wszystkich członków społeczności przed wszelkimi krzywdami.

Rejestracja na Mastodon.com.pl

Rejestracja na naszej instancji dostępna jest dla każdego, kto utworzy na niej swoje konto i zatwierdzi jej regulamin.

Finansowanie

Ta instancja jest w pełni sponsorowana i utrzymywana przez firmę hostingową MGHost.

Podejście moderacyjne

Rola administratora czy moderatora sprowadza się do konkretnych obowiązków, a nie do politycznej oceny wpisów czy sądownictwa. Nasz świat ma nieskończenie wiele wymiarów, nie jest czarno-biały, ma mnóstwo kolorów i odcieni – każdy z nas jest inny. Nie będziemy definiować aspektów wolności czy przyzwoitości, ponieważ one same się określają, a określone granice prawne (jeszcze) są wystarczające do ich przestrzegania.

Informujemy, że instancja prawnie podlega całkowicie pod Prawo Polskie 🇵🇱 i Unii Europejskiej 🇪🇺.

Zgłaszanie niedozwolonych treści oraz procedura odwoławcza:

  1. Użytkownik, który uważa opublikowaną na instancji treść za nielegalną, lub naruszającą warunku Regulaminu, może przesłać do Administratora zgłoszenie dotyczące tej treści za pomocą funkcji "Zgłoś", dostępnej przy każdym toot'cie.
  2. Administrator, lub Moderator rozpatruje zgłoszenie, bez zbędnej zwłoki, oraz podejmuje decyzję co do treści, której dotyczy zgłoszenie, w sposób terminowy (do 7 dni), niearbitralny, obiektywny i z zachowaniem należytej staranności.
  3. O podjętej decyzji, Administrator/Moderator powiadamia zgłoszonego i zgłaszającego Użytkownika.
  4. Decyzja Administratora może polegać na usunięciu treści, pozostawieniu treści na instancji, lub też zawieszeniu całego konta.
  5. Użytkownik może odwołać się od decyzji Administratora w terminie 7 dni od otrzymania uzasadnienia jej usunięcia kontaktując się z Administratorem za pośrednictwem adresu e-mal contact@mastodon.com.pl.
  6. Odwołanie powinno zawierać wyczerpujące uzasadnienie.
  7. Administrator rozpatruje odwołania w terminie 7 dni.

Instancja ELK

Alternatywna opcja korzystania z serwisu za pomocą skryptu ELK, dostępnego w tym miejscu: elk.mastodon.com.pl.

Administratorzy & Moderatorzy serwera

Kierunkowy74

Dodatkowe informacje

Zobowiązujemy się do bieżącego utrzymywania instancji oraz stałego informowania wszystkich jej użytkowników o informacjach jej dotyczących. Główne źródło informacji na temat instancji dostepne jest za pośrednictwem konta: notifications.

Wykorzystujemy własną infrastrukturę mailową - nie blokujemy żadnych głównych dostawców usług e-mail.

Status

Globalny status dostępności serwera, dostępny tutaj

Punkt kontaktowy

Administrator wyznaczył elektroniczny punkt kontaktowy związany z instancją mastodon.com.pl przeznaczony do bezpośredniej komunikacji z organami państw członkowskich, Komisją i Radą Usług Cyfrowych: contact@mastodon.com.pl. Komunikacja może być prowadzona w języku polskim, lub angielskim.

Zmiany Regulaminu

Instancja mastodon.com.pl może wprowadzać zmiany do całości, lub części postanowień Regulaminu. Wszelkie zmiany, lub modyfikacje obowiązują z chwilą ich zamieszczenia na instancji mastodon.com.pl. O wszelkich zmianach w Regulaminie, instancja mastodon.com.pl będzie informować za pośrednictwem konta: notifications. Użytkownik niniejszym wyraża zgodę na regularne sprawdzanie treści Regulaminu oraz jego aktualizacji, aby zapoznać się z ewentualnymi zmianami. Korzystanie z instancji mastodon.com.pl po wprowadzeniu zmian do Regulaminu będzie oznaczać ich akceptację. W przypadku niewyrażenia zgody na takie zmiany przez Użytkownika, Administracja instancji mastodon.com.pl prosi o usunięcie konta i rezygnację z dalszego korzystania z instancji mastodon.com.pl

EN:

Mastodon Poland is a resurrection of the old instance that had its first, test run in July 2019. We want to provide a safe & free instance of the Mastodon open social network protecting all members of community from any harm.

Registration on Mastodon.com.pl

The registration process is available for everyone on this instance as long as they create an account and accept the terms and conditions of this instance.

Moderation Approach

The role of the administrator or moderator comes down to specific duties and not to the political evaluation of entries or the judiciary. Our world has infinitely many dimensions, is not black and white, it has a lot of colors and shades - each of us is different. We will not define the aspects of freedom or decency beacuse these define themselves, and the defined legal boundries (yet) are sufficient to comply with them.

We want to inform that the instance is completely subordinate to Polish 🇵🇱 and European law 🇪🇺.

Reporting prohibited content and appeal procedure:

  1. A user who considers content published on the instance to be illegal or in violation of the Terms of Service may submit a report to the Administrator regarding this content using the "Report" function, available with each toot.
  2. The Administrator or Moderator shall review the report without undue delay and make a timely (within 7 days), non-arbitrary, objective decision regarding the reported content, exercising due diligence.
  3. The Administrator/Moderator notifies both the reported and reporting users of the decision made.
  4. The Administrator's decision may involve removing the content, leaving it on the instance, or suspending the entire account.
  5. A user may appeal the Administrator's decision within 7 days of receiving the justification for its removal by contacting the Administrator via email at contact@mastodon.com.pl.
  6. The appeal should include comprehensive justification.
  7. The Administrator shall review appeals within 7 days.

ELK instance

An alternative option to use the service using the ELK script, available at: elk.mastodon.com.pl.

Server Administrators & Moderators

Administrators:

spoofy
paulina

Moderators:

Kierunkowy74

Funding

This instance is fully sponsored and maintenanced by a MGHost hosting company.

Additional information

We are committed to maintaining the instance on an ongoing basis and constantly informing all its users about information related with it. The main source of information about the instance is delivered through this account: notifications.

We use our own email infrastructure - we don't block any major e-mail service providers.

Status

Global server availability status, available here.

Contact Point

The Administrator has designated an electronic contact point associated with the mastodon.com.pl instance for direct communication with the authorities of member states, the Digital Services Commission, and the Council: contact@mastodon.com.pl. Communication can be conducted in Polish or English.

Changes to the Terms of Service

The mastodon.com.pl instance may introduce changes to the entirety or part of the provisions of the Terms of Service. All changes or modifications take effect immediately upon their posting on the mastodon.com.pl instance. The mastodon.com.pl instance will inform about any changes in the Terms of Service through the account: notifications. By using the mastodon.com.pl instance, the user hereby agrees to regularly check the contents of the Terms of Service and their updates to become familiar with any changes. Continued use of the mastodon.com.pl instance after changes to the Terms of Service have been made will signify acceptance of those changes. In the event that the user does not consent to such changes, the Administration of the mastodon.com.pl instance kindly requests the deletion of the account and discontinuation of further use of the mastodon.com.pl instance.

Social networking, back in your hands

Sharing your thoughts has never been more convenient. Publish anything you want: links, pictures, text, video. All on a platform that is community-owned and ad-free.

You have 1000 characters. You can adjust the thumbnails of your pictures with focal points. You can use custom emojis, hide things behind spoiler warnings and choose who sees a given post. Messed it up? You can delete & redraft for quick corrections.

Without an incentive to sell you things, Mastodon allows you to consume content you enjoy uninterrupted. Your feed is chronological, ad-free and non-algorithmic—you decide who you want to see!

Description:
A Mastodon server for Greater Boston/Massachusetts/New England folks interested in a more inclusive, sustainable, and equitable region.

Many members come from transportation equity and policy backgrounds. While this server is for everyone, there may be a lot of local talk about those topics!

If you wish migrate your account, instead of simply making a new account, use this page as a resource and follow these steps:

  1. Back up your account data
  2. Make a new account on this server (check your spam for the confirmation email!)
  3. Alias your old account to the new account by creating an alias on this server
  4. Move your followers by using the "Move to a different account" function on your old server.
  5. Upload your following list to the new account

Please note that posts are not moved when you move servers; this is due to technical limitations.

Server Status and Funding

This instance is currently running on a server donated by @flyyn - your friendly local devops masshole who's currently between jobs.

The server will likely need to be tuned and upgraded as members join.

Please consider donating to keep things running smoothly! We have a Ko-Fi page set up to collect funds.

Registration

This server has a generally open registration policy, for anyone who agrees to abide by our rules.

At times, we may require approval for new members, to ensure safety and technical stability. We will process registrations as quickly as feasible.

Username Tip - we are in a world of federated servers. Usernames must be unique '@better.boston', but you will be sharing space with other servers.

You may wish to choose something that stands out, similar to a Twitter username. Sure, '@bones@better.boston' is (currently) available, but conversations with '@bones@mastodon.social' will get confusing fast!

Volunteers

This Mastodon instance is administered by Matthew, who also conceptualized it.

Technical operation and hosting by Flyyn.

Moderation Policy

We actively moderate this server; this is not a "free-speech zone".

However, while we are dedicated to moderation, our labor is on a volunteer basis and we cannot see everything.

If you find any objectionable material on this server or elsewhere, please report the content so we can take appropriate action.

Description:
Welcome to mograph.social

The main purpose of this server is to connect people from the broad motion design community, including VFX artist, animators (more in general designers and artists that are interested in moving images) and to contribute to the Fediverse with interesting content. It is also a place to offer to people in these fields an open space for discussion outside the toxic boxes of mainstream social media.

If you need more information about Mastodon, about what it is and how it works, have a look at fedi.tips.

Code of Conduct

In general

Be excellent to each other and respect the rules.

Keep always in mind that the aim of our server is community building and sharing of ideas and interests in respect of each others.

If you're a new member please fill in your profile with the relevant information as soon as you can so we know who we're talking to, and add a profile picture. Also it is recommended to make an #introduction post with the appropriate hashtag to tell a bit about yourself and your interests.

Crossposting

Crossposting from other networks like Twitter is allowed but if done regularly the posts should be marked as unlisted. Most importantly the account owner should be active in the conversation on our Mastodon server as well.

If you leave your account alone while crossposting it could be silenced.

Long threads

If you plan to post a long thread please post all the messages after the first one as unlisted so you don't spam the public timelines. Otherwise your account could be silenced.

Uploading videos

Due to the nature of our interests we naturally tend to share videos. While doing so please remember that the storage space on the server is not unlimited neither free. We encourage you if possible to upload your content on other platforms of your choice (YouTube, Vimeo, PeerTube, e.g.) and then post them as links here.

Image descriptions

Please add an image description for any picture or video you upload so that people on a screen reader can follow along too.

Advertising and self-promotion

Mograph.social aims at community building and not at advertising. This space is paid by the community for the community via donations and we can't accept people using it to do their free advertising campaigns. It's considered self-promotion: showcasing your art, your portfolio and skills, sharing your video tutorials, podcasts, offering/looking for work. If you're here to make a daily advertising campaign of your brand/products with the broadcasting of posts (or threads of posts) into the void, it's not going to work. Explicit advertising posts with links to direct products/services for sale will be deleted and your account might get silenced.

People, not brands, please.

Personal Pronouns

We encourage you to add your pronouns to your profile if you want them to be used and also check your folks profiles for pronouns before engaging in conversation with them.

Support mograph.social

Mograph.social is run by members of the community. Please consider becoming a patron/backer or making a donation to help us keeping the server up and running:

Become a Patron
Donate on LiberaPay
Donate on Ko-Fi
Donate on PayPal

Mastodon Server Covenant

mograph.social fully subscribes to and complies with the Mastodon Server Covenant.

Hosting Information

mograph.social is fully hosted and managed by Masto.host..

Description:
Welcome to VT Social!

NOTE: Please read the "Joining VT Social" section below before applying, or we may reject your application.

VT Social is a fediverse instance for VTubers run by VTubers. Our goal is to provide a space for VTubers and VTuber-adjacent content creators, so we can connect with each other and have a place for fans to discover our content.

About us

VT Social is run by Lina, a tech VTuber with a passion for VTuber technology and empowering everyone to be a VTuber. She spends most of her time working on open source GPU drivers, and also has experience with systems administration. She decided to start this instance to provide a place for all other VTubers to gather together! ✨

Our instance is based on the glitch-soc fork of Mastodon, which adds things like better notification controls and the ability to use formatting in posts (our own fork is here and it's based on the Treehouse version, in case you're curious!). Over time, we plan to modify Mastodon to add better tools for VTubers to share their content and allow others to find it.

This instance is hosted on our own hardware at a data center, and we have plans for expanding it and scaling it to be able to host everyone! We know VTubers love to post images and videos, so we are especially committed to having enough storage for all of you, starting with over 10TB of space right off the bat and able to scale up! Right now the instance is still on default settings for upload limits, but we will be optimizing it and customizing it to give everyone better options soon.

The VT Social logo is based on a concept by K.O.D.A., itself inspired by the nullptr::live logo by soundflora*.

Rules and guidelines

Please see our instance rules below for the official policy, but in summary: we want VT Social to be a friendly space for all VTubers free of harassment or abuse. We're all in this together trying to have a good time and connect with fans and supporters, and we hope you are too! Here are a few guidelines to keep in mind:

  • Be friendly with fellow VTubers! Light-hearted rivalry is okay, but don't let it escalate into name-calling or attacks. We all want to coexist together, not fight!
  • Be respectful of others' identities and styles. VTubing gives us the power to be whoever we want to be - embrace it for yourself and for others!
  • Don't discuss the IRL identities of other VTubers, including speculation. This is considered on par with doxxing! Let's respect each others' privacy!
  • Don't sexualize others or make advances on them without consent. Many people aren't comfortable with that!
  • Tag all R18/NSFW content as sensitive, and add a CW if necessary (e.g. gore). Do not direct suggestive/NSFW content at minors, nor involve minors or minor-presenting personas in such content.

This instance allows R18/NSFW images, but all such content must be tagged as sensitive, and you should add CWs as necessary. The line for what counts as NSFW varies by culture, but we expect all content depicting sex acts (censored or not) or genitalia to be marked as such. We recommend that users who frequently post such content enable the "Always mark media as sensitive" option under Preferences → Other, and accounts primarily aimed at an 18+ audience must clearly mention "18+" in the bio. If you repeatedly fail to mark media as sensitive, we will mark your account as enforced-sensitive.

We do reserve the right to use our own judgement in difficult cases, and may ask you to tone it down or remove certain content if we think it is necessary. And although we hope to never have to resort to it, if we ever have to ask someone to leave the instance, we will give them enough time to use the Fediverse migration tools to move their account and followers to another instance.

Joining VT Social

VT Social is open to all VTubers and content creators who work with them! To make sure the people on the instance are genuine creators, we ask that you prove who you are and show that you are an active content creator.

  • If you are a VTuber, you need to have at least 2 stream VODs or videos using your avatar (2D, 3D, PNG) totaling at least 1 hour of content.
  • If you are a VTuber-related content creator or illustrator, you need to have created official content/illustration work for one or more VTubers at least two times, or be actively involved in a VTuber-centric creation or development project. VTuber managers are also welcome.
  • Illustrators with a focus on VTuber fanart are also welcome, as long as it is a significant part of your work and welcome by the VTubers you draw (memes don't count!).

These are not hard rules, and we are open to being flexible as long as you are part of the VTubing community!

In order to prove that you are who you say you are, please add your desired username (@someone@vt.social) to a website or social media page you control, and link it when you request an account on the instance (bio, tweets, subpages, posts, files on a domain, etc. are all fine). When you request an account, please tell us:

  • A little bit about yourself and what you do (just one sentence or two is enough)
  • A link to your verification post/page (you need to mention your VT Social username there!)
  • A link to your existing content
  • If you are a manager or otherwise associated with a VTuber, a link that we can use to verify your relationship

Please post a tweet or make mention of your application on your socials, so we can verify who you are! Something like "I'm joining VT Social at @myusername@vt.social", or even just "I'm applying for a VT Social account!" if you use the same username on both sites is all we need. You can also add your @myusername@vt.social ID to your bio instead. Please link to the post/tweet/bio when you apply, and tell us what you did if it's not obvious, so we can verify you quickly! This helps us make sure the person creating the account is not an imposter claiming to be you.

What if I'm just getting started and I don't have any content yet?

No worries! You can sign up on any other instance, and then, once you have some content, move to VT Social! Mastodon and the Fediverse allow you to move your account over and bring all your old followers, and make sure anyone who lands on your old account gets redirected to your new one.

What about fans?

Thanks to the awesomeness of the fediverse, you can connect with fans hosted on any other instance! We want to focus on the content creators themselves, so that we can help fans discover their content and find new VTubers to follow all in one place, as well as connect together VTubers and artists, modelers, riggers, and more. We think we can do a better job by working to make the best instance for creators, instead of having a general-purpose instance where anyone can sign up.

Federation policy

VT Social federates with everyone by default, and we only preemptively defederate instances in egregious cases (e.g. instances run by known serial harassers or openly hosting and condoning hate groups). However, we do expect all instances to have basic moderation and rules forbidding harassment. If we receive multiple reports from users of an instance, and it does not appear to have such rules nor be moderated appropriately, we will defederate it in order to protect our users. If you admin such an instance and have corrected the situation, please email lina@asahilina.net in order to request to have federation reinstated.

Content legality and CWs

VT Social is hosted in Japan and subject to Japanese law. We recognize that there are certain classes of content on other instances which many users may not wish to see, and which may vary in legality in other countries. For instances which host large amounts of such content without the appropriate CWs or sensitive tags, we may use media restrictions to effectively mark such media as sensitive in public timelines. We plan to work on our own improvements to Mastodon in the future, to provide finer-grained controls so that we can ensure we don't create unnecessary divisions between communities while empowering our users to decide what kinds of content they wish to see, and balance their own risk of exposure to unwanted content. At VT Social, we expect our own users to use sensitive tags and CWs appropriately, and have stricter policies for content on the instance as mentioned above.
Short: The biggest VTuber instance, by VTubers for VTubers and adjacent content creators.

Urusai! Social is...

...a toxicity-free, English-first anime/manga and otaku community. We're focused on providing a safe place for fans of otaku culture to share their interests, whatever they are.

This server uses relays to increase the variety and quantity of content on the Federated timeline. Current relays in use are:

https://relay.neovibe.app/inbox

https://relay.sakurajima.moe/inbox

Defederation:

Urusai! aggressively defederates with servers that may violate our Code of Conduct, based on information provided by other server admins. We do not publish our block-list here to prevent bots from scraping it and notifying bad actors, but you can find it in our git repo

We are a "block first, ask questions later" community. Any server block may be challenged by any Urusai! user and an audit will be performed to determine if they should stay blocked.

Code of Conduct:

rules.urusai.social/mastodon-coc.html. TLDR: be a sensible, nice human being. Harassment, insults, bigotry etc. won't be tolerated.

Usage Guidelines:

rules.urusai.social/mastodon-guidelines.html. TLDR: it's mostly about things that might interest fans of anime and other otaku stuff. Preferred language is English.

This server is run by @neatchee; let me know if you have any issues or suggestions, or see inappropriate activity. If you'd like to contribute to server costs and snacks for contributors you can donate on ko-fi

Additional Attributions:

The custom glitch flavors/styles 'Gekka', 'Sakura', and 'Holiday' are graciously provided via AGPL by chikorita157 of sakurajima.moe and can be found in their GitHub repo

'Vanilla modern' uses CSS provided by Freeplay while other '-modern' variants were adapted by chikorita157

The 'Birdsite' style provided by ronilaukkarinen

Only content posted by users with "@urusai.social" in their username is managed by this server. If you find infringing material from a user on our server, make sure it is not covered by Fair Use, then send your takedown request to this instance's admin email (neatchee@ansemreport.com). Description:
Welcome to SEO.chat

An open source, social network based on Mastodon, and focused on SEO. Managed by @fili@seo.chat.

This Mastodon server was created and set up for the SEO community to have a place to come together, share knowledge and test things out. Its primary service is to provide a platform for the Search Engine Optimization community.

The primary instance language is English.

Best efforts are made to keep the server up and running, but sometimes things may be outside the admin's control, such as the managed hosting provider experiencing downtime, or Google inadvertently mistaking the server for phishing.

Code of Conduct

SEO.chat aims to be a nice community of marketers, sharing and helping each other. You are welcome to join!

Basic rules:

  • Be polite and kind. Don't be a jerk. Religious speech, hate speech, discrimination, and harassment of any kind is not tolerated on this server.
  • Be respectful - even if you disagree.
  • No spam or commercial advertisements.
  • This server is intended for anyone who works in the field of Search Engine Optimization.
  • The primary language for this server is English. Although it is fine to discuss SEO examples/cases/details related to different markets, languages and locales, make sure that the primary language of your posts are in English.

And everything will be fine.

When applying to join

When you sign up to join, you will be asked to provide an answer to "Why do you want to join?". Take a moment to write down your response. If your response is unrelated to SEO and is lacking the requested information, your application to join will likely be rejected.

This server is committed to the Mastodon Server Covenant and is hosted in Germany.

Best practices

The list below is a collection of behavior expected from SEO.chat users. If you see a user go against these best practices in a way that bothers you, please file a report and the moderators will talk to them. While these best practices are designed to be guidelines for a good communal instance, repeated malicious unwillingness to follow the best practices will be considered just like breaking a rule.

  • In general, use the tools provided to foster a considerate and accessible atmosphere. This includes the liberal use of content warnings (especially on potentially disturbing or controversial topics), and alt-text captioning of media files.
  • When possible, provide credit for creative works in your posts that are not your own.
  • Uninvited comments about another user's personal choices, lifestyle or family are strongly discouraged and may be considered harassment. Inappropriate sexual attention, comments about appearance and implication of physical contact will not be tolerated toward any non-consenting user.
  • If you post potentially graphical content or gore, use content warnings.
  • If you post any advertisements, use a content warning. Advertisements should not be excessive or automated.
  • Bots may only interact with a user when they're invited by that user to do so.
  • Automated posts and high-frequency posts should be unlisted (rendering visible to everybody, but not appearing on the local timeline) to keep the local timeline of SEO.chat instance a place of community dialogue and human interaction. This extends to bots, feed posters, Twitter "retweets" and Twitter crossposts with broken mentions ("…@twitter.com"). Crossposter accounts that stop being active participants in SEO.chat community may be removed at the discretion of the moderators.
  • In discussions, please remain civil, do not insult the people you're talking to. Note that irony, sarcasm, or similar modes of language don't translate well to written language and tend to escalate discussions or misunderstandings.
  • Do not debate moderation actions in public posts. If you disagree with how a moderator enforced the rules you may direct-message the moderation team.

(These best practices were inspired by the Terms of bsd.network and chaos.social. Thank you!)

Content not allowed

The following rules are a (non-exhaustive) list of behaviors and type of content that may lead to deletion of toots, silencing or suspension of accounts, at the discretion of the instance administrators, as described in the SEO.chat Terms.

  • Any illegal content (doxing, leaking private information, under age content, etc)
  • Adult (pornography) content
  • Spam
  • Commercial advertisements
  • Racism
  • Political content
  • Alt right, including under the disguise of freedom of speech
  • Gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions

We reserve the right to suspend and/or delete your account at our discretion.

We reserve the right to take any actions towards any instances that are connected with this instance. If your instance is considered problematic by our staff, we will silence or completely suspend it.

You may discuss with staff if you feel you were unfairly sanctioned (through DMs or via email if your account is suspended). However, there is no guarantee that the verdict will be revoked.

Our infrastructure is hosted primarily in Germany, as such German laws do apply for the content hosted.

Licenses

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

Blobfox, drgn, gphn, Neofox and vlpn emoji provided by Volpeon.

Dragn emoji provided by chr-1x.

Modern theme by Freeplay

About this Server

This server is hosted via IONOS on a VPS with 8 shared CPU cores, 12GB of RAM and 240GB of SSD storage. Outside of system upgrades or version upgrades, there should be no downtime.

Media is stored on Backblaze B2 Cloud Storage with a current limit of ~1TB.

Backups are run on a weekly basis, provided by DigitalOcean.

Additionally, E-Mail services are currently provided by SendinBlue on the free tier. This heavily limits the volume of E-Mails that can be sent per month, abuse of notifications may lead to warnings and/or account suspension.

Any of the above may change as demand/available funds change, feel free to make a one-time or recurring donation at my (@Oric's) ko-fi or Patreon to help keep the server running and/or upgrade specs.

You can check a more detailed look at our Finances here: https://oric.dev/macrofurs_finances

Description:
What is LURK?

LURK is both a collective and a community of communities. We host, facilitate and archive discussions around net- and computational culture and politics, proto- and post-free culture practices, (experimental) (sound) (new media) (software) art, and things like that…

We’re volunteer run and wish to:

  • give the opportunity for individuals, groups and collectives working on net- and computational culture to have a presence outside of corporate silos, surveillance capitalism and closed facebook groups;
  • offer a place where discussions and resources on self-hosting and alternative network infrastructures can exist outside of libertarian and pepe discourses;
  • provide ourselves with something high-quality to procrastinate with, share good memes and eat pop-corn;
  • etc.
This is our Mastodon instance, but we also run a couple other things.

Is this for you?

The relevant themes/practices/topics at LURK are art, sound and design practices that engage with:
  • net and computational politics/culture/critique/history
  • play, gaming, modding
  • art servers, self-hosting, networked infrastructures including alternative social media and networks
  • generative and algorithmic processes
  • proto-, post- FLOSS development, publishing and licensing
  • digital and networked media such as live coding, net art, software art
  • post-digital practices including media archeology/reflective nostalgia
  • electronics, microcontrollers, DIY/DIWO making, hardware prototyping
  • redefining technology in relation to sustainability and ecology like repair culture, permacomputing, collapse informatics
  • graphic and visual design, zines, experimental publications, print making
  • alternative economic models, modes of organization and production

While these topics expand beyond the scope of art, sound and design practices, we want LURK to be specifically welcoming for art, sound and design practitioners, from makers to writers.
Short: A fediverse community for discussions around cultural freedom, experimental, new media art, net and computational culture, and things like that.
